description: From Middle English teching, techinge, from Old English tǣċing, tǣċung (“instruction, direction, teaching”), equivalent to teach +‎ -ing.

entries.meaning: Something taught by a religious or philosophical authority.
examples: Many follow the teachings of Confucius.

entries.meaning: The profession of educating people; the activity that a teacher does when he/she teaches.
examples: Teaching has seen continual changes over the past decades.
I have found a teaching job.

description: From Middle English techinge, techynge, techende, techand, from Old English tǣċende, from Proto-Germanic *taikijandz, present participle of Proto-Germanic *taikijaną (“to show, point out”), equivalent to teach +‎ -ing.
